1.name: A Gay Old Boy
1.description: "A pretty maid is busy putting a blank record into a graphophone on the parlor table. Mr. Gayboy comes in and kisses the maid several times against her will; all unaware of the fact that ...                See full summary »

2.name: Cendrillon
2.description: A fairy godmother magically turns Cinderella's rags to a beautiful dress, and a pumpkin into a coach. Cinderella goes to the ball, where she meets the Prince - but will she remember to leave before the magic runs out?

3.name: King John
3.description: King John does whatever it takes to keep himself on the throne of England, making enemies of the pope, France, and his nephew along the way.

4.name: La colonne de feu
4.description: A devil conjures up a dancing woman from a mystical flame.

5.name: Le diable au couvent
5.description: Satan appears in a convent and takes the guise of a priest. Before long he is causing all manner of perturbation and despair.

6.name: L'affaire Dreyfus
6.description: Dramatized re-enactments of the events of the Dreyfus-affair from 1894 to 1899.

7.name: Cléopâtre
7.description: A man digging inside an Egyptian tomb chops up a mummy, then resurrects the woman inside it.

9.name: Casey at the Bat
9.description: "The umpire makes a decision that Casey doesn't like, and an argument follows, during which Casey deftly trips him up, and continues the argument on the ground. The other players run from ...                See full summary »

11.name: The Kiss in the Tunnel
11.description: A humorous subject intended to be run as a part of a railroad scene during the period in which the train is passing through a tunnel.

12.name: Défilé de voitures de bébés à la pouponnière de Paris
12.description: A long line of nurses pushing carts with their babies enter from the far right, cross a garden in front of the large nursery home, and leave by the close left to the camera. A few toddlers ...                See full summary »

14.name: Momijigari
14.description: Historical nobleman Taira no Koremori fights a demon who has disguised itself as Princess Sarashina.

15.name: La petite fille et son chat
15.description: A short black and white film which documents the activities of a little girl and her cat.

16.name: Suicide du Colonel Henry
16.description: Major Hubert-Joseph Henry commits suicide, in a dramatization of the events surrounding the Dreyfus Affair, an actual historic event.

17.name: Lady Contortionist
17.description: "Here is shown Mlle. De La Roy, the well-known dancer who has a national reputation. The lady seems to be double jointed, as she twists herself in every conceivable shape. This film shows ...                See full summary »

18.name: Raising Old Glory Over Morro Castle
18.description: "Down goes the Spanish flag, and up floats the Stars and Stripes. Down falls the symbol of tyranny and oppression that has ruled in the new world for four hundred years, and up goes the ...                See full summary »

19.name: L'impressionniste fin de siècle
19.description: A magician and his assistant perform numerous magic acts.

20.name: Évocation spirite
20.description: A magician presents a wreath which in turn transforms into other things.

21.name: Attentat contre Maître Labori
21.description: A dramatization of a real event, in which Fernand Labori, defense lawyer for Captain Dreyfus in the Dreyfus Affair, was shot and wounded in the back by an unknown assailant who escaped.

22.name: Le portrait mystérieux
22.description: A magician has a picture frame set up. He then proceeds to make a second version of himself appear inside it.

23.name: Un bon lit
23.description: A sleeping apartment of a friend who retires for the night. The rays of the moon are shining upon the bed through the window. He is suddenly awakened by a bug of gigantic proportions ...                See full summary »

24.name: Operación de quiste hidatídico de pulmón

25.name: Arrest of Dreyfus
25.description: Du Paty de Clam instructs Captain Dreyfus to write to see if his handwriting matches the writing of the traitorous Bordereau. Du Paty de Clam finds the handwriting to match and accuses ...                See full summary »

26.name: Panorama from the Tower of the Brooklyn Bridge
26.description: Filmed from the Brooklyn tower of the bridge, this is a panorama starting at Manhattan's Battery and then panning northward along the East River shoreline.

27.name: How Would You Like to Be the Ice Man?
27.description: "This film was taken after the popular song by the same title, and is a funny picture indeed. A book agent calls on a woman, who is engaged in washing clothes. He proceeds to try to ...                See full summary »

28.name: La dictée du bordereau
28.description: Dictation of the statement of Captain Dreyfus in reference to the Dreyfus Affair, a political scandal that rocked France from 1894 to 1906.

29.name: The Flume
29.description: Prior to our event partnership with Hype Machine, we had never explored the idea of shooting a DJ. But after experiencing the up-and-comers who showed face at this year's Hype Hotel, you ...                See full summary »

30.name: The Biter Bit
30.description: Two men work in a large garden, one of them watering with a hose and wearing a boater. A young man in apron and cap sneaks into the scene, hides behind a bush, and kinks the hose. The man ...                See full summary »

31.name: Matches: An Appeal
31.description: A stop-motion match makes a written appeal to the audience, asking them to send money that will go to matches for British soldiers fighting overseas.

32.name: Baby's Bath
32.description: "In this picture the figures are very large and very clear photographically. The young mother is seen giving her little girl her morning bath in a porcelain tub. The little one splashes the...                See full summary »

33.name: Au cabaret
33.description: Everyone knows that mixing gambling and liquor can produce unexpected and occasionally dangerous results. As true today as it was back in the late-1800s (when this dramatic short subject was made).

34.name: Débarquement à Quiberon
34.description: Captain Dreyfus gets off the ship at Quiberon during the Dreyfus Affair, an actual historic event.

35.name: Les krémos: Pyramide
35.description: A black and white short film of a group of acrobats creating a human pyramid.

36.name: Le spectre
36.description: A lady is seated at her desk writing when a burglar enters and strangles her. He stabs her and after wrapping her in a sheet throws her in a trunk and then proceeds to steal her jewelry. He...                See full summary »

37.name: Danse serpentine par Mme. Bob Walter

38.name: Reproduction of the Corbett and Jeffries Fight

39.name: Na afloop der kindervoorstelling in den Circus Carré, 13 september

40.name: Upside Down; or, The Human Flies
40.description: A Spiritualist causes a group of table-turners to walk upside down on the ceiling.

41.name: Salle à manger fantastique
41.description: Showing the interior of a dining room of a modest cottage, whereto enter a young couple to partake in their meal, which is being served up by the maid. Suddenly the legs of the table are ...                See full summary »

43.name: Cripple Creek Bar-Room Scene
43.description: A vignette of a barroom/liquor-store in the West, no plot per se. However this short is usually regarded as the first "Western" in the sense that it depicts a western scene.

44.name: Tent Pegging
44.description: "Fourteen old timers driving one of the stakes which support the canvass of a circus tent."

45.name: One Thousand Mile Tree, Weber Canyon

46.name: Combat de coqs
46.description: The interior of a room, showing two Bantam cocks fighting. Of the many cock fights heretofore exhibited, this is without doubt the liveliest and best, being full of action. From a photographic standpoint it is certainly perfect.

47.name: Luttes extravagantes
47.description: In a square room, two men and two women, in white body-hugging clothes, try on wrestling holds, each with a partner of the same sex.

49.name: Le miroir de Cagliostro
49.description: Another magical trick well worth having. A large frame is seen hanging on the wall. Suddenly a basket of flowers appears therein, followed by a picture of a beautiful lady. This picture ...                See full summary »

50.name: Entretien de Dreyfus et de sa femme à Rennes
50.description: Captain Dreyfus is reunited with his wife after being falsely imprisoned.
